bibl.title: Letter from Philip Showalter Hench to John J. Moran, October 18, 1940

div1.p: Hench questions Moran concerning the possible Camp Lazear buildings.

div1.head: Letter from Philip Showalter Hench to John J. Moran, October 18, 1940
div1.p:
I was much pleased with your letter and the ab-
stracts from the Rojas day book which came yesterday. I
hope you got my cable. The following unfinished business
you may or may not be able to do before you come:
1. Have you got the photostatic copy of the
Zunzungei contract? This is most important. If so, can
you airmail it to me? I will have it translated here.
2. How about the matter of the chimney hole
being in the left instead of the right corner?
3. Are the foundations of Building No. 2 eighty
yards from Building No. 1?

Will be seeing you in a few days and we will
have much to talk over.
div1.closer: Sincerely, P. S. Hench, M. D. psh:ds
